text: This letter is from Paul, a servant owned by God, and a missionary of Jesus Christ. I have been sent to those God has chosen for Himself. I am to teach them the truth that leads to God-like living.
speaker: Narrator

text: This truth also gives hope of life that lasts forever. God promised this before the world began. He cannot lie.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made this known at the right time through His Word. God, the One Who saves, told me I should preach it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am writing to you, Titus. You are my true son in the faith which we both have. May you have loving-favor and peace from God the Father and Jesus Christ, the One Who saves.
speaker: Narrator

text: I left you on the island of Crete so you could do some things that needed to be done. I asked you to choose church leaders in every city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their lives must be so that no one can talk against them. They must have only one wife. Their children must be Christians and known to be good. They must obey their parents. They must not be wild.
speaker: Narrator

text: A church leader is God’s servant. His life must be so that no one can say anything against him. He should not try to please himself and not be quick to get angry over little things. He must not get drunk or want to fight. He must not always want more money for himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: He must like to take people into his home. He must love what is good. He must be able to think well and do all things in the right way. He must live a holy life and be the boss over his own desires.
speaker: Narrator

text: He must hold to the words of truth which he was taught. He must be able to teach the truth and show those who are against the truth that they are wrong.
speaker: Narrator

text: There are many men who will not listen or will not obey the truth. Their teaching is foolish and they lead people to believe a lie. Some Jews believe their lies.
speaker: Narrator

text: This must be stopped. It turns whole families from the truth. They teach these things to make money.
speaker: Narrator

text: One of their own teachers said, “People of the island of Crete always lie. They are like wild animals. They are lazy. All they want to do is eat.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This is true of them. Speak sharp words to them because it is true. Lead them in the right way so they will have strong faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not let them listen to Jewish stories made up by men. Do not let them listen to man-made rules which lead them away from the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: All things are pure to the man with a pure heart. But to sinful people nothing is pure. Both their minds and their hearts are bad.
speaker: Narrator

text: They say they know God, but by the way they act, they show that they do not. They are sinful people. They will not obey and are of no use for any good work.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must teach what is right and true.
speaker: Narrator

text: Older men are to be quiet and to be careful how they act. They are to be the boss over their own desires. Their faith and love are to stay strong and they are not to give up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Teach older women to be quiet and to be careful how they act also. They are not to go around speaking bad things about others or things that are not true. They are not to be chained by strong drink. They should teach what is good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Older women are to teach the young women to love their husbands and children.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are to teach them to think before they act, to be pure, to be workers at home, to be kind, and to obey their own husbands. In this way, the Word of God is honored.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also teach young men to be wise.
speaker: Narrator

text: In all things show them how to live by your life and by right teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: You should be wise in what you say. Then the one who is against you will be ashamed and will not be able to say anything bad about you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who are servants owned by someone must obey their owners and please them in everything. They must not argue.
speaker: Narrator

text: They must not steal from their owners but prove they can be trusted in every way. In this way, their lives will honor the teaching of God Who saves us.
speaker: Narrator

text: God’s free gift of being saved is being given to everyone.
speaker: Narrator

text: We are taught to have nothing to do with that which is against God. We are to have nothing to do with the desires of this world. We are to be wise and to be right with God. We are to live God-like lives in this world.
speaker: Narrator

text: We are to be looking for the great hope and the coming of our great God and the One Who saves, Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gave Himself for us. He did this by buying us with His blood and making us free from all sin. He gave Himself so His people could be clean and want to do good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Teach all these things and give words of help. Show them if they are wrong. You have the right and the power to do this. Do not let anyone think little of you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Teach your people to obey the leaders of their country. They should be ready to do any good work.
speaker: Narrator

text: They must not speak bad of anyone, and they must not argue. They should be gentle and kind to all people.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was a time when we were foolish and did not obey. We were fooled in many ways. Strong desires held us in their power. We wanted only to please ourselves. We wanted what others had and were angry when we could not have them. We hated others and they hated us.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God, the One Who saves, showed how kind He was and how He loved us
speaker: Narrator

text: by saving us from the punishment of sin. It was not because we worked to be right with God. It was because of His loving-kindness that He washed our sins away. At the same time He gave us new life when the Holy Spirit came into our lives.
speaker: Narrator

text: God gave the Holy Spirit to fill our lives through Jesus Christ, the One Who saves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of this, we are made right with God by His loving-favor. Now we can have life that lasts forever as He has promised.
speaker: Narrator

text: What I have told you is true. Teach these things all the time so those who have put their trust in God will be careful to do good things. These things are good and will help all men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not argue with people about foolish questions and about the Law. Do not spend time talking about all of your early fathers. This does not help anyone and it is of no use.
speaker: Narrator

text: Talk once or twice to a person who tries to divide people into groups against each other. If he does not stop, have nothing to do with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: You can be sure he is going the wrong way. He is sinning and he knows it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will send Artemas or Tychicus to you. As soon as one of them gets there, try to come to me in the city of Nicopolis. I have decided to spend the winter there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zenas, the man who knows the law, and Apollos are going on a trip. Do everything you can to help them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our people must learn to work hard. They must work for what they need and be able to give to others who need help. Then their lives will not be wasted.
speaker: Narrator

text: All those with me here greet you. Greet my Christian friends there. May you have God’s loving-favor.
speaker: Narrator
